job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for an communicative DEV Engineer to strengthen us in Credit Risk. We are looking for engineers who can push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture. In this chapter we deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing.
       Who are we?
       COO Risk and Finance delivers baseline and change activities for both Risk and Finance. Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING. We play a critical role at ING and will be the go-to function for all kinds of data across the Bank.
       Your main focus
          + Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
          + Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
          + Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
          + Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
          + A bank is based on trust of their customers. Therefore, your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
          + Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
          + Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
          + Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
       In addition to developing software solutions, you will contribute to:
          + We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
          + Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
          + Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future. Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
          + In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
       Your work environment
       You will work in the TECH organization of COO Risk and Finance. You will be part of the Vortex team delivering IT solutions and services for the Credit Risk Tribe. The Vortex teams operate according to the Scrum Agile development process. The focus is on high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time. The key development technology used in your squad are Java, Oracle 19, Linux, and Kafka. The Azure DevOps is the single solution used for version control, build, release etc.
job_details.full_text:
Dev Engineer Java

We are looking for an communicative DEV Engineer to strengthen us in Credit Risk. We are looking for engineers who can push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture. In this chapter we deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing.
       Who are we?
       COO Risk and Finance delivers baseline and change activities for both Risk and Finance. Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING. We play a critical role at ING and will be the go-to function for all kinds of data across the Bank.
       Your main focus
          + Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
          + Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
          + Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
          + Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
          + A bank is based on trust of their customers. Therefore, your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
          + Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
          + Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
          + Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
       In addition to developing software solutions, you will contribute to:
          + We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
          + Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
          + Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future. Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
          + In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
       Your work environment
       You will work in the TECH organization of COO Risk and Finance. You will be part of the Vortex team delivering IT solutions and services for the Credit Risk Tribe. The Vortex teams operate according to the Scrum Agile development process. The focus is on high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time. The key development technology used in your squad are Java, Oracle 19, Linux, and Kafka. The Azure DevOps is the single solution used for version control, build, release etc.

job_profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software engineering, data engineering, and MLOps principles within a banking context, but lacks specific mentions of AI or ML model development, fine-tuning, or generative techniques. While it mentions 'big data' and 'calculations', it does not specify predictive or generative modeling.

job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates the role is within a specific business domain (Credit Risk) and aims to improve its capabilities, aligning with understanding business context.

job_tasks.phrase: push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the need to understand the strategic direction and architectural evolution of the credit risk program, which is a business-level concern.

job_tasks.phrase: thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture
job_tasks.justification: This involves strategic thinking and application of architectural concepts to business problems, fitting under business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing
job_tasks.justification: This directly describes data processing, validation, and loading into systems, which are core data engineering activities.

job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines
job_tasks.justification: ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) solutions and calculation engines are fundamental components of data engineering pipelines.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications
job_tasks.justification: This task involves the architecture and implementation of data delivery to a data warehouse, a key data engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications
job_tasks.justification: Focusing on stability, performance, and reliability of applications, especially in a production environment, aligns with operational engineering concerns.

job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product
job_tasks.justification: This emphasizes end-to-end responsibility for software development and support, a core aspect of software engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards
job_tasks.justification: Focus on building trustworthy software and applying security standards is a crucial part of robust software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
job_tasks.justification: Building deployment pipelines for CI/CD is a direct MLOps/DevOps activity.

job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process
job_tasks.justification: Automating testing within the software development lifecycle (design, code, build, release) is a key MLOps/DevOps practice.

job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring
job_tasks.justification: Product ownership and implementing observability/monitoring are critical for production system maintenance and operations.

job_tasks.phrase: share and teach your knowledge to other team members
job_tasks.justification: Sharing and teaching knowledge to team members is a form of communication and collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: Optimization of the service stability and continuity
job_tasks.justification: Service stability and continuity are operational concerns, aiming to keep systems running reliably.
Improving CI/CD maturity is a direct objective within operations engineering.
Containerization (e.g., Docker) is a common practice in modern operations and MLOps for deployment and management.

job_tasks.phrase: prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
job_tasks.justification: Cloud migration and management are key aspects of modern operations engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future
job_tasks.justification: Developing a future vision for service delivery requires understanding business goals and strategic direction.

job_tasks.phrase: high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time
job_tasks.justification: Focus on delivering high-quality, secure software on time is a fundamental aspect of software development.

soft_skills.phrase: share and teach your knowledge to other team members
you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product
you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards
prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future
